entry.title: Fix RTL in TabStrip
Align with cookieEnabled spec in 3p contexts
entry.content: https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/10256

entry.title: GWP-ASan: control parameters at process granularity
entry.content:
On a [recent (Google-internal) thread, we found that browser processes on Mac hit GWP-ASan exhaustion quite a lot](https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/chrome-memory-tok/c/ixQeTMwpP5w/m/FrUI2rRlAAAJ). Basically everything else outside this specific combination is fine.
The agreement we reached was to vary parameters by process. We need to address the browser process specifically, but the others may also have different allocation patterns that call for different parameters.
Side note: the exhaustion histograms tell us that Mac browser processes are hitting exhaustion relatively _early_. This suggests an early burst of long-lived allocations. I think we could introduce a parameterized delay (independent of the sampling rate etc.) to get around this.

entry.title: Investigate which browserState to load at startup
No depth indicator scrollbar seen when scrolling with the keyboard
entry.content: Chrome 124. 1. Choose any webpage. To keep things reproducible, say chrome://version/ . 2. OK, now scroll down, using two fingers on the trackpad. On the right margin the scrollbar appers, letting us know how deep we are in the file. 3. Now instead scroll down via holding down the keyboard down arrow key. No scrollbar appears. When we hit the bottom of the file "the elevator comes to a sudden halt and the people have to look outside (check by using the trackpad to scroll) to see what happened -- Oh, we're at the bottom floor."

entry.title: Cannot intermix trackpad and keyboard scrolling
entry.content:
Chrome 124. Today we open the Chrome browser on a Chromebook. 1. Let's choose any webpage. To keep things reproducible, say chrome://version/ . 2. OK, now scroll down, using two fingers on the trackpad. 3. As is our habit, we sometimes also scroll using the keyboard down arrow button. Do that. 4. Whammo! The page rolls back up like one of those old fashioned window shades, at 60 miles per hour. Our reading position is lost forever, and we are now back staring at the top of the file.
Proof that the Chrome team is doing things wrong: Scrolling using the keyboard first and then switching to the trackpad respects positions. But doing it in the opposite order does not!

entry.title: Tests are failing: system_health_smoke_test.py(158): AssertionError: 1 != 0 : Benchmark run failed: system_health.memory_desktop
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): system_health_smoke_test.py(158): AssertionError: 1 != 0 : Benchmark run failed: system_health.memory_desktop
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_perf_unittests/benchmarks.system_health_smoke_test.SystemHealthBenchmarkSmokeTest.system_health.memory_desktop/load_accessibility:shopping:amazon:2018 - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_perf_unittests/benchmarks.system_health_smoke_test.SystemHealthBenchmarkSmokeTest.system_health.memory_desktop/load:news:hackernews:2018 - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_perf_unittests/benchmarks.system_health_smoke_test.SystemHealthBenchmarkSmokeTest.system_health.memory_desktop/load:tools:weather:2019 - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_perf_unittests/benchmarks.system_health_smoke_test.SystemHealthBenchmarkSmokeTest.system_health.memory_desktop/load:media:youtubelivingroom:2020 - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_perf_unittests/benchmarks.system_health_smoke_test.SystemHealthBenchmarkSmokeTest.system_health.memory_desktop/load:news:reddit:2018
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/f5613f6abef60796b0e6e9118f1219d3
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Turn test failures into tree closers
entry.content: The DevTools waterfall is in awesome shape now thanks to the new tools we have. Let's make test failures tree closers again?

entry.title: dawn_lpm_fuzzer_vulkan_backend_with_tint: Indirect-leak in dawn::native::vulkan::Device::Create
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=4879495107379200
Fuzzing Engine: centipede Fuzz Target: dawn_lpm_fuzzer_vulkan_backend_with_tint Job Type: centipede_chrome_asan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Indirect-leak Crash Address: Crash State: dawn::native::vulkan::Device::Create dawn::native::vulkan::PhysicalDevice::CreateDeviceImpl dawn::native::PhysicalDeviceBase::CreateDevice
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Crash Revision: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=centipede_chrome_asan&revision=1287955
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=4879495107379200
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.
************************* UNREPRODUCIBLE ************************* Note: This crash might not be reproducible with the provided testcase. That said, for the past 14 days, we've been seeing this crash frequently.
It may be possible to reproduce by trying the following options: - Run testcase multiple times for a longer duration. - Run fuzzing without testcase argument to hit the same crash signature.
If it still does not reproduce, try a speculative fix based on the crash stacktrace and verify if it works by looking at the crash statistics in the report. We will auto-close the bug if the crash is not seen for 14 days. ******************************************************************

entry.title: Add timeout to awaiting target resumption
entry.content:
Before we start tracing we suspend all DevTools targets, and after tracing we resume them all.
We recently had a bug (https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/333989070) where the perf panel would get stuck in "Processing" and never update.
The root cause of this was that we have a line that awaits the resumption of targets, and if a target does not resume, we hang forever.
What we should do is something like:
``` await Promise.race([resumeTargets(), tenSecondTimeout()]) ```
And if we hit the timeout, update the status to say "Error resuming targets, please reload DevTools and try again".
It's still not a great user experience, but it is much better than simply freezing and not telling the user what is happening.

entry.title: HSTS not cached on cached responses with code 300
entry.content:
If a response with status code 300 includes an HSTS header, the header only works the first time the page is loaded, later loads will load the response from the disk cache without the HSTS header.
To reproduce: - Visit [test URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/upgrade-hsts.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=HSTS&first_id=32481&last_id=32481&scheme=http&t_resp_id=32481&t_element_relation=direct_direct&t_resp_origin=https://sub.headers.websec.saarland) - Disable cache in devtools (reload a couple of times) and observe "redirected: true" - Enable cache in devtools (reload a couple of times) and observe "redirected: false"
I would expect the HSTS header to also be cached.

entry.title: [Design Doc] Review request for Bling’s Quick Delete DD
entry.content:
[Bling’s Quick Delete DD](http://docs/document/d/1hTDzm53pV4VBxRIa0J8oIGshWGtbhcikDrURRKUOyqQ?tab=t.0)
Design description: Quick delete intends to give users a way to quickly delete their last 15 minutes of browsing data. We’re bringing the quick delete feature to Bling. We have already launched it on [Clank](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DUlG_j3ywqXkcjsqiVDf7l9QGa9jN8NvMrChByaBWAo/edit?resourcekey=0-sVqpn-JQ3DhTN5l-Wb5Rlw&tab=t.0).

entry.title: WebRTC setCodecPreferences with AV1 fails due to inconsistent ftmp options
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open https://webrtc.github.io/samples/src/content/peerconnection/change-codecs/ in chrome v124 2. click button "start" 3. select "video/AV1" from codec preferences dropdown 4. click button "call"
# Problem Description After call setup, you'll see the output "Using video/VP8, payloadType=96. Encoder: "libvpx". Power efficient: false.". Have a look at the DevTools Console, filter for error logs and see the following error ``` main.js:172 Uncaught TypeError: Failed to execute 'setCodecPreferences' on 'RTCRtpTransceiver': The provided value is not of type 'RTCRtpCodecCapability'. ``` The reason is that RTCRtpSender.getCapabilities('video').codecs has only 1 entry for AV1 which does not match with on of the entries for AV1 in RTCRtpReceiver.getCapabilities('video').codecs. Tthe RTCRtpSender AV1 codec is missing the sdpFmtpLine.
# Additional Comments I have tested in Chrome Canary v126 and there it works, because the RTCRtpSender.getCapabilities('video').codecs AV1 entry also provides the sdpFmtpLine. My problem is, that I'm working for a company that has a WebRTC product where we use the setCodecPreferences feature, which suddenly fails with AV1 when Chrome v124 came out.
# Summary WebRTC setCodecPreferences with AV1 fails due to inconsistent ftmp options
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>WebRTC
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Show magnifying glass "+" icon earlier
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Let's say one is loading an enormous image that doesn't fit the screen. You know, just browsing a .jpg, with no surrounding web page. Well, after the image fully loads, the pointer becomes a magnifying glass symbol with a "+" in it. At this point the image is still shrunken to fully fit the browser. When the user clicks then it enlarges to its full extent, and the pointer becomes a "-" symbol.
No, sorry, I don't have any big images to give you links for, and you don't have a slow enough network to see what I'm talking about.
# Problem Description OK, so what's the problem? The problem is the "+" symbol should appear earlier, as indeed the user can click any time, to at least enlarge the image while it is loading.
# Summary Show magnifying glass "+" icon earlier
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: PDF A11y serialization - InvalidAXNodeID
entry.content:
AXUpdatesAndEvents collects accessibility-related updates and events, which are then processed by RenderAccessibilityImpl to manage accessibility features. Based on the latest changes, it looks like there are some conditions where RenderAccessibilityImpl will fail to set the root_id for the first update after the reset token is triggered. At the event listener to these events , the root_id is set to "InvalidAXNodeID." This prevents us from unserializing the updates, causing some features not to start, leading to continuous loading.
Any thoughts on why root id is InvalidAXNodeID ? We think similar topic is discussed in https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40928791#comment30
Impacted versions : 123 & 124

entry.title: Removing a focused control with an editContext from the DOM breaks editing in the page
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Set up a page with an element A with an editContext and some other text input B 2. Focus element A 3. Remove element A from the DOM 4. Focus element B and try to input text 5. Nothing happens
# Problem Description This sequence of steps seems to put the page into a state where the edit context, though no longer associated with a focused element, continues to receive the text input (it fires further events), blocking any other editing.
# Additional Comments Attached HTML page demonstrates the issue.
# Summary Removing a focused control with an editContext from the DOM breaks editing in the page
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: HardwareDisplayPlaneManager: Add testing for DRM blobs
entry.content:
We currently only test if DRM blobs are set, but don't actually check the data that is passed to them.
This starts to get dangerous with the newer color management code, which needs that data to represent precise things.

entry.title: Change the logic of deciding if CBCM is present to be more permissive
entry.content: The previous logic was testing for *both* enrollment and dm-tokens which is actually wrong because once enrolled the enrollment token is not neccessary and vice versa the absense of dm-tokem doesn't mean it won't be created soon thereafter based on the enrollment token present.

entry.title: Android hwasan bots cannot reproduce testcases
entry.content:
Please, see crbug.com/333014970.
Basically, it seems that CF fails at correctly scheduling a hwasan job for reproducing a testcase.
Chatted with titouan@ about this: "I'm not sure how it all works, but I recall Pâris mentioning an issue around this" (pmeuleman@).
It seems to be a known issue/limitation with the current way we're scheduling Android jobs.
This bug will track down improvements on this issue.

entry.title: The button to Relaunch the chrome tabs is not working properly.
entry.content:
Chrome Version : Version 124.0.6367.60 (Official Build) (arm64) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : Monteray 12.1 Behavior in Chrome: When you click on the Relaunch tabs button for update. After the update is done there is a dialogue box which shows Relaunch Button. Clicking on it doesn't close the browsers normally. You need to click twice or thrice properly to close the browsers and open it again.
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Make sure your browser is due for update (2) Click on Update Chrome (3) A dialogue box will open which says update is completed relaunch browser/tabs (4) Click on the Relaunch button. Nothing will happen. Then you wait for sometime and click again 1 or 2 times. Then the browsers get closed and tabs open again.
What is the expected result? The browser gets closed in a simple click on the button
What happens instead? It's irritating for the user to click again and again. And the user may decide to not update the browser which can lead to a security vulnerability.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about:gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Omnibox keeps searching for localhost instead of visiting the page
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6422.3 (Official Build) canary (arm64) OS: macOS Version 14.4.1 (Build 23E224)
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Run chrome with the following flags: --force-fieldtrials="*OmniboxMlScoringWithCachingDesktop/Control_50pct/*OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop/EnabledConservative_25pct_20240405/*OmniboxOnDeviceHeadModelSelectionFix/Default" --force-fieldtrial-params="OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop.EnabledConservative_25pct_20240405:MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlending/true/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingGroupingThreshold/1000/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingMax/2000/MlUrlSearchBlending_MappedSearchBlendingMin/0/MlUrlSearchBlending_StableSearchBlending/false" --enable-features="MlUrlSearchBlending<OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop"
(2) Enter 'http://localhost:8080' in the omnibox
What is the expected result? The page (with the globe icon) is the top result
What happens instead? It tries to use the search engine instead.
Running chrome with --disable-features="MlUrlSearchBlending<OmniboxMlScoringWithLinearMappingDesktop" seems to fix the issue for me. And resetting my field trials seems to fix it as well.

entry.title: evaluateJavaScript is not type compatible in Swift
entry.content:
This is another finding when exposing //ios/web_view to Swift code where nullable/nonnullable results in distinct types (Optional<Foo> vs Foo).
evaluateJavascript, the current updated version has three differences to the WKWebView version:
1. The callback argument is called completion instead of completionHandler which looks to be because there was another version that had completionHandler already which has since beeen removed. 2. The callback is not optional in Swift which is unfortunate since calling it with nil is very common. 3. The error argument in the callback is not optional which creates an unnecessary type difference

entry.title: Single clicking the title bar when maximized forces a resize
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open chrome 2. Ensure chrome is maximized 3. Click away from chrome or load another app such that the Chrome window no longer has primary focus 3. Single click any open space on the title bar that isn't a tab, tab creation button, or window sizing buttons 4. Verify the window is resized and given primary focus rather than simply focused
# Problem Description This is occurring on Ubuntu 24.04. I have confirmed this occurs with chrome beta and dev builds as well.
When single clicking on the title bar while some other window has focus, focus should be restored but the browser window should not resize out of its maximized state.
When single clicking the title bar while it is NOT maximized, the window does not change size or restore maximization.
This behavior does not occur on Windows.
This behavior does not occur if using the "System title bars" instead of the default Chrome title bars.
This behavior does not occur in Firefox.
# Additional Comments Attached is a screencast of this taking place, using the calc app in front of the browser with focus, then single clicking the title bar while maximized to demonstrate the unexpected resize behavior.
# Summary Single clicking the title bar when maximized forces a resize
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Performance regression issue related to Blink Accessibility events
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a new Chrome Tab, and open this link https://illustrator.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:AP:755a3bda-ecd2-476b-bf39-00ddfde4e19a 2. Run the DevTools performance profiling and till the link is fully opened (may take 5-15 seconds) and analyze the main thread call stacks. 3. On profiling, it looks the Main Thread spending ~4 seconds in Blink.Accessibility.UpdateTime > ProcessDeferredAccesibilityEvents.
# Problem Description I am seeing a potential performance regression issue with recent Chrome updates related to Blink Accessibility events. AI Web launch performance (I am using M1 Machine, Sonoma 14.4.1, Chrome Version 123.0.6312.107(arm64), but was happening on older os 13.x too) seems to degrade by upto 4 seconds (from ~4secs to ~8 secs). On profiling, it looks the Main Thread spending ~4 seconds in Blink.Accessibility.UpdateTime > ProcessDeferredAccesibilityEvents. When I launch Chrome with accessibility disabled (open -n -a "Google Chrome" --args www.adobe.com --disable-renderer-accessibility), the issue is no more reproducible so its seems bug is related to accessibility handing in Chrome. Our app is doing nothing in general related to accessibility. Moreover, the issue is not consistent on all machines hence I need Google Accessibility team or Blink rendering team help to isolate this regression. Sample Link: (not sure if it will repro on the machines you will try) https://illustrator.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:AP:755a3bda-ecd2-476b-bf39-00ddfde4e19a Can someone include relevant folks in this thread?
# Additional Comments This issue is happing on specific machines.
When I launch Chrome with accessibility disabled (open -n -a "Google Chrome" --args www.adobe.com --disable-renderer-accessibility), the issue is no more reproducible so its seems bug is related to accessibility handing in Chrome.
# Summary Performance regression issue related to Blink Accessibility events
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Internals
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Add annotation to reject invalid script state
entry.content:
In [this CL](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/5428013) I was trying to eliminate the boilerplate of checking for invalid script state but ran into the problem that the `Reject` call takesthe invalid script state, which [causes the promise to be `undefined`](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/b8751512266083748593/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Fmodel-execution%2Fwpt_internal%2Fmodel-execution%2Frun-from-detached-iframe.html+VHash%3Acd53377797674ec7&clean=&sortby=&groupby=).
The bindings code avoids this because it uses the receiver's script state in ExceptionToRejectPromiseScope.
I would like to just annotate my bindings with something like `RejectInvalidScriptState` and remove `RaisesException` and not even call my impl if the script state is invalid.

entry.title: chromium net_unittests WebSocketEndToEndTest.HttpsWssProxyUnauthedFails hangs with latest vpython
entry.content:
In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5458681 , I tried to update vpython to the latest released version for the test configuration. This caused WebSocketEndToEndTest.HttpsWssProxyUnauthedFails to reliably time out.
We believe there may be a locking bug in vpython related to starting two python test servers concurrently. We should be able to fix it in vpython if so.
